title: Disneyplus Error 83
body:
### OS/Platform

Fedora and CentOS

### Installed

Flatpak

### Version

 112.0.5615.165 

### Have you tested that this is not an upstream issue or an issue with your configuration?

- [X] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [X] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there
- [X] I have tried reproducing this issue in ungoogled-chromium with a new and empty profile and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

When I try to turn on a movie on Disney plus, I get the error code (Error 83). 

### How to Reproduce?

1. go to disneyplus 
2. open a Movie or Episode
3. The Error code 83 appears

### Actual behaviour

When I try to start a movie on Disney plus, I just get an error message. In the logs it says only :30:17.326 Mel[1] 5301 DRM_SYSTEM_ACCESS_FAILED no drm system access for com.widevine.alpha -while- starting 1-c Multivariant playlist url: null
c

### Expected behaviour

Actually the film should start

### Relevant log output

```sh
ndor.aa6e91ed2604bc6a2238.js:2 You are currently using minified code outside of NODE_ENV === "production". This means that you are running a slower development build of Redux. You can use loose-envify (https://github.com/zertosh/loose-envify) for browserify or setting mode to production in webpack (https://webpack.js.org/concepts/mode/) to ensure you have the correct code for your production build.
c

ndor.aa6e91ed2604bc6a2238.js:2 (ERROR):  [ErrorEpic] Fatal Error {playhead: 0, cause: 'error', errorName: null, error: 'drmDecryption', errorDetail: '5301 DRM_SYSTEM_ACCESS_FAILED no drm system access for com.widevine.alpha -while- starting 1-c', …}
c
:30:17.326 Mel[1] 5301 DRM_SYSTEM_ACCESS_FAILED no drm system access for com.widevine.alpha -while- starting 1-c Multivariant playlist url: null
c
```

title: Can't install any extensions
body:
### OS/Platform

Debian, Ubuntu, and derivatives

### Installed

Flatpak

### Version

Version 111.0.5563.146 (Official Build, ungoogled-chromium) (64-bit)

### Have you tested that this is not an upstream issue or an issue with your configuration?

- [X] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [X] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in ungoogled-chromium with a new and empty profile and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

I am unable to install any extensions either from file or from the webstore

### How to Reproduce?

1. Go to Webstore
2. Click on extension Page
3. Install/add button will not be present

Alternatively for local installs

1. Go to chrome://extensions
2. Enable developer mode
3. Drag crx extension into window to install it

### Actual behaviour

When attempting to install from the webstore the button to install the extesnions isn't there on the extension page. If I try to go to the crx link directly it'll say that the extension cannot be installed from this site.

When attempting to install locally it'll give the message CRX_REQUIRED_PROOF_MISSING

### Expected behaviour

The extensions should install without hitch or complaints and the install button should be present in the webstore

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

title: System font scaling being ignored, text too small as result
body:
### OS/Platform

Opensuse Tumbleweed

### Installed

Flatpak

### Version

Version 111.0.5563.64 (Official Build, ungoogled-chromium) (64-Bit)

### Have you tested that this is not an upstream issue or an issue with your configuration?

- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in ungoogled-chromium with a new and empty profile and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

The system font scaling is being ignored, the text stays too small as result, for e.g. in all UI elements and bookmarks.
Changing the font size in settings doesn't change the text in those UI elements. 

### How to Reproduce?

Running GNOME 43.3
Goto Gnome Tweaks 
Fonts
Adjust scaling factor to for e.g. 1.5
run Ungoogled Chromium
Nothing changes the font doesn't adjust.

The normal scaling (display settings) does work however for e.g. 200%.

### Actual behaviour

The font stays small

### Expected behaviour

The fonts adjust to the scaling factor

### Relevant log output

```sh
Note sure if this output is relevant to the issue:
cb@tumbleweed-pc:~> flatpak run com.github.Eloston.UngoogledChromium 
libva error: vaGetDriverNameByIndex() failed with unknown libva error, driver_name = (null)
[2:2:0318/173553.466780:ERROR:object_proxy.cc(623)] Failed to call method: org.freedesktop.ScreenSaver.GetActive: object_path= /org/freedesktop/ScreenSaver: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NotSupported: This method is not implemented
```

title: How about to fix: window-position and window-size
body:
### OS/Platform

Linux

### Installed

Flatpak, Appimage, apt

### Version

109

### Have you tested that this is not an upstream issue or an issue with your configuration?

- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in ungoogled-chromium with a new and empty profile and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

New window position and size are ignored

### How to Reproduce?

1. Run normal Chromium window and then sized one
```
firejail --env=DESKTOPINTEGRATION=appimaged --noprofile --appimage ${HOME}/Downloads/Chromium-107.0.5297.0.glibc2.17-x86_64.AppImage \
--user-data-dir=/tmp/tmp-chr-dir "https://wttr.in" @@ >/dev/null 2>&1 &
sleep 3s
firejail --env=DESKTOPINTEGRATION=appimaged --noprofile --appimage ${HOME}/Downloads/Chromium-107.0.5297.0.glibc2.17-x86_64.AppImage \
--user-data-dir=/tmp/tmp-chr-dir --window-size=800,600 --window-position=100,100 --chrome-frame --app="https://wttr.in"

```

2. Run normal Ungoogled-Chromium (Appimage) window and then sized one
```
firejail --env=DESKTOPINTEGRATION=appimaged --noprofile --appimage ${HOME}/Downloads/ungoogled-chromium_107.0.5304.110-1.1.AppImage \
--user-data-dir=/tmp/tmp-ung-chr-dir "https://wttr.in" @@ >/dev/null 2>&1 &
sleep 3s
firejail --env=DESKTOPINTEGRATION=appimaged --noprofile --appimage ${HOME}/Downloads/ungoogled-chromium_107.0.5304.110-1.1.AppImage \
--user-data-dir=/tmp/tmp-ung-chr-dir --window-size=800,600 --window-position=100,100 --chrome-frame --app="https://wttr.in"

```

3. Run normal Ungoogled-Chromium (Flatpak) window and then sized one
```
flatpak run --branch=stable --arch=x86_64 --command=/app/bin/chromium --file-forwarding com.github.Eloston.UngoogledChromium @@u \
--user-data-dir=/tmp/tmp-ung-chr-flt-dir "https://wttr.in" @@ >/dev/null 2>&1 &
sleep 3s
flatpak run --branch=stable --arch=x86_64 --command=/app/bin/chromium --file-forwarding com.github.Eloston.UngoogledChromium @@u \
--user-data-dir=/tmp/tmp-ung-chr-flt-dir --window-size=800,600 --window-position=100,100 --chrome-frame --app="https://wttr.in" @@

```

### Actual behaviour

`--window-position` and `--window-size` options are ignored if you start a normal window before starting a sized window



### Expected behaviour

`--window-position` and `--window-size` options are respected if you start a normal window before starting a sized window

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Additional context

Known Chromium bags:
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=823991
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=178104

title: unable to build ungoogled chromium for portable linux anymore since new 109.0.5414.xx versions
body:
### OS/Platform

Portable Linux

### Installed

Compiled from source

### Version

109.0.5414.74-1

### Have you tested that this is not an upstream issue or an issue with your configuration?

- [x] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [x] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there
- [x] I have tried reproducing this issue in ungoogled-chromium with a new and empty profile and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

my build procedure for portable linux fails since the new 109.xxx versions

### How to Reproduce?

execute docker-build.sh in https://github.com/clickot/ungoogled-chromium-build

### Actual behaviour

the ninja build for chrome fails during typescript compilations because of assignments of String to TrustedHtml Type and vica versa


### Expected behaviour

the ninja build procedure completes successfully

### Relevant log output

```sh
[27959/54204] ACTION //ui/webui/resources:library(//build/toolchain/linux/unbundle:default)
FAILED: gen/ui/webui/resources/tsconfig_library.json gen/ui/webui/resources/library.manifest [...many lines]
python3 ../../tools/typescript/ts_library.py --root_dir gen/ui/webui/resources/preprocessed --gen_dir gen/ui/webui/resources --out_dir gen/ui/webui/resources/preprocessed --output_suffix library --in_files [...many lines]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/repo/target/src/out/Default/../../tools/typescript/ts_library.py", line 220, in <module>
    main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/repo/target/src/out/Default/../../tools/typescript/ts_library.py", line 183, in main
    node.RunNode([
  File "/repo/target/src/third_party/node/node.py", line 34, in RunNode
    raise RuntimeError('Command \'%s\' failed\n%s' % (' '.join(cmd), err))
RuntimeError: Command '/repo/target/src/third_party/node/node_modules/node-linux-x64/bin/node /repo/target/src/third_party/node/node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc --project gen/ui/webui/resources/tsconfig_library.json' failed
gen/ui/webui/resources/preprocessed/cr_elements/cr_a11y_announcer/cr_a11y_announcer.ts:90:7 - error TS2322: Type 'TrustedHTML' is not assignable to type 'string'.

90       messagesDiv.innerHTML = window.trustedTypes!.emptyHTML;
         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

gen/ui/webui/resources/preprocessed/js/custom_element.ts:26:5 - error TS2322: Type 'string | TrustedHTML' is not assignable to type 'string'.
  Type 'TrustedHTML' is not assignable to type 'string'.

26     template.innerHTML =
       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Found 2 errors in 2 files.

Errors  Files
     1  gen/ui/webui/resources/preprocessed/cr_elements/cr_a11y_announcer/cr_a11y_announcer.ts:90
     1  gen/ui/webui/resources/preprocessed/js/custom_element.ts:2
```


### Additional context

i've been using my build procedure successfully for about a year now, and except of minor adjustements converning the used llvm version and stack and some node installation details that were neccessary over time, it worked fine for me, until the new 109 version. Since i don't have a glue how to fix the issue (i played around with the used node version, without success) i wonder if some of You guys could give me a hint where to look at (as I assume that you of course sucessfully executed builds of the new version, including linux). 

About my build procedure: it is based on the build in ungoogled-software/ungoogled-chromium-portablelinux repo, that i adapted and adjusted until it worked for me. i use a debian bullseye based docker image with the current llvm 15 version (15.0.7 at this moment) and the node lts 16.xx version and execute a bash build script in it that is an adapted version of the build.sh in the portablelinux repo. So (i think) i just apply the patches from ungoogled-chromium  and execute the ninja builds (first gn tool, then chromium) without own code adjustements.

Thanks in advance for any hint or advice!

title: Download fails because of DBus.Error.NoReply
body:
### OS/Platform

Debian, Ubuntu, and derivatives

### Installed

Compiled from source

### Version

Version 103.0.5060.134 (Official Build, ungoogled-chromium) Debian GNU/Linux (64-bit)

### Have you tested that this is not an upstream issue or an issue with your configuration?

- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in ungoogled-chromium with a new and empty profile and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

File download fails because of putative DBus NoReply error

### How to Reproduce?

Download a file, choose location for it.

### Actual behaviour

This is a brand new, upgraded install of Debian 11 with KDE Plasma. Nothing exciting going on. When I download a file, the normal system file dialog appears but when it is submitted nothing happens and the console prints the following:

> [1608:1626:0104/143022.653046:ERROR:select_file_dialog_linux_portal.cc(719)] Portal returned error: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.


### Expected behaviour

Naturally the file should be downloaded to the user's chosen destination.

### Relevant log output

```sh
[1608:1626:0104/143022.653046:ERROR:select_file_dialog_linux_portal.cc(719)] Portal returned error: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken.
```


### Additional context

Workaround is to uncheck the "Ask where to save each file before downloading" option in `chrome://settings/?search=downlo`

title: Completely indistinguishable from original upstream Chromium
body:
### OS/Platform

macOS

### Installed

OS/Platform's package manager

### Version

103

### Tested upstream?

- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

Ungoogled Chromium cannot be distinguished in any reliable way from upstream

### How to Reproduce?

1.) try to find a way whether a given installed copy of Chromium is "Ungoogled" or original

### Actual behaviour

Cannot be distinguished

### Expected behaviour

I expect to have a reliable way to distinguish "ungoogled" chromium from the original

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Additional context

Our MacUpdater aims to correctly display the latest version (and possibly automatically) update any macOS software ever released. 

MacUpdater can correctly distinguish these Chromium forks:

Chedot
Chromium
Epic
ipDTL
Iron
RocketNav
Superbird
URBrowser

however, Ungoogled Chromium is indistinguishable from the original and will therefore result in wrong version number display.

NOTE: all other chromium forks are distinguishable by the `CFBundleName` entry in `Chromium.app/Contents/Resources/en.lproj/InfoPlist.strings`

so, if you could set set this value to "Chromium Ungoogled" this issue would be nicely fixed - thanks!

title: Can't detect and update components on chrome://components
body:
### OS/Platform

Windows

### Installed

https://ungoogled-software.github.io/ungoogled-chromium-binaries/

### Version

101.0.4951.64

### Tested upstream?

- [X] I have tried reproducing this issue in Chrome and it could not be reproduced there
- [ ] I have tried reproducing this issue in vanilla Chromium and it could not be reproduced there

### Description

chrome://components failed to update components and detect their versions

### How to Reproduce?

1. Go to chrome://components and you'll find every component has the same version of 0.0.0.0
2. Click on 'Check for update', it shows 'Updater started'
3. Click on 'Check for update' again, it shows 'Checking for status…'
4. Keep Clicking and waiting, nothing happens

### Actual behaviour

Described in 'How to Reproduce?' section

### Expected behaviour

Every component shows its version and can be updated successfully

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Additional context

As we know UC has trouble playing DRM protected content, even if you follow the [guide](https://chromium.woolyss.com/#comment-1500), it still won't work properly (see #1258).

To most people my issue seems to be a subtle one, but I'm afraid it is components checking failure that leads WidevineCdm to behave abnormally.

I've tested on Chrome, Brave, Vivaldi and Edge, Widevine works properly with them. And on their components page every component shows it version and can be updated successfully. 

Widevine also did nothing wrong, I checked the CRC32 of WidevineCdm folder, Brave and Vivaldi store it in UserData, they are same, Chrome and Edge store it in Application\[version] folder and they are same too.

So there might be some problems on ungoogled layer(?) (#1831 ) I hope this info are helpful for solving problem.

title: Adjust argument length assertion in add-suggestions-url patch
body:
Chromium commit https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/d30ba01286cdedafe6a77e91950854da81acb4f4
added an assertion to check that the args list has a size of 3. As the
patch adds the suggestions url as an additional argument, the browser
would crash when reaching the code.

This only affects ungoogled-chromium release 102.0.5005.61-1 as previous
chromium releases didn't include this commit.

First reported here https://github.com/ungoogled-software/ungoogled-chromium-archlinux/issues/189.

title: fix-building-without-safebrowsing.patch incomplete?
body:
Hi all,

while updating the windows build I encountered a linking error because the symbol `safe_browsing::EventResultToString` is not found. The function is used multiple times in the file `chrome/browser/extensions/api/safe_browsing_private/safe_browsing_private_event_router.cc`, but most calles are within `FULL_SAFE_BROWSING` ifdef blocks inserted by the `fix-building-without-safebrowsing.patch` patch except for one call around line 313 in function `SafeBrowsingPrivateEventRouter::OnPolicySpecifiedPasswordReuseDetected`.

The missing function is implemented in the file `chrome/browser/safe_browsing/cloud_content_scanning/deep_scanning_utils.cc` which is not compiled because the patch `0001-fix-building-without-safebrowsing.patch` disables compiling of the safe_browsing files defined in `chrome/browser/safe_browsing/BUILD.gn`.

I was wondering if windows is the only platform affected by this problem or if this should be fixed in this repo's patch.

title: ld step fails with undefined reference to 'safe_browsing::****'
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am trying to package ungoogled-chromium for the Mageia rpm Linux distribution. I am using their spec file of Chromium as a base, same version. I have paid attention to include the ng args provided (otherwise, the build step fails with 'tab_strip_model.cc:1781:62: error: comparison of integer expressions of different signedness'). 
I then succeeded to almost complete the build step, but it fails at the last operation:

title: Crashes on gcm::GCMClientImpl::StartGCM() ()
body:
**Describe the bug**
Ungoogled-chromium gcm::GCMClientImpl::StartGCM() () with SIGSEGV

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any pleroma instance you can log in i.e. https://cdrom.tokyo/
2. Register / Log in
3. Open settings
4. Scroll down and enable "enable web push notifications" (only works when logged in)
5. Wait or Refresh page -> Crash

**Expected behavior**
No crashes

**Screenshots**
```
Thread 9 "Chrome_IOThread" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 0x7fffe59c7700 (LWP 190671)]
0x000055555b16ed6d in gcm::GCMClientImpl::StartGCM() ()
```

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS/Platform and version: Debian Linux x86 bullseye/sid
 - ungoogled-chromium version: 89.0.4389.114-1.buster1

**Additional context**
Root cause is that webpage tries to use WebPush which relies on centralized servers GCM and whatever apple/mozilla uses, but GCM isn't properly removed and trying to use it causes a crash. Doesn't happen with that setting disabled, doesn't happen on stock (as debian's one can get) chromium.

title: Fix gn conflict with Android
body:
The component name used for ungoogled_switches.h will conflict in v86 on Android:
```
ERROR at //build/config/BUILDCONFIG.gn:576:5: Duplicate output file.
    target(_target_type, _target_name) {
    ^-----------------------------------
Two or more targets generate the same output:
  libswitches.cr.so

This is can often be fixed by changing one of the target names, or by 
setting an output_name on one of them.

Collisions:
  //components/ungoogled:switches
  //device/gamepad/public/cpp:switches
```

This should solve the problem.

title: Websites with remember login function will always forget login session since Chromium 80 (Not related to cookies clearing every shutdown)
body:
**Describe the bug**
Since Chromium 80, websites with remember login function will always forget login session
Reverting to Chromium 79 will allow websites to actually remember login sessions
Sites affected: a lot, including github.com, facebook.com, twitter.com, searx preferences, duckduckgo.com preferences, whatever websites that saves login session 99% will forget it after Chromium relaunch

Clear cookies and site data when you quit Chromium is **DISABLED**

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Login to website
2. Close Chromium
3. Open website

**Expected behavior**
Website will remember login session.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS/Platform and version: Windows 10 Enterprise Version 2004 OS Build 10.0.19041.450
 - ungoogled-chromium version: 84.0.4147.135-1 built by tangalbert919

**Additional context**
**Flags**
--flag-switches-begin --user-data-dir=..\profile --no-default-browser-check --allow-outdated-plugins --disable-logging --disable-breakpad --disable-machine-id --disable-encryption --extension-mime-request-handling=always-prompt-for-install --fingerprinting-canvas-image-data-noise --fingerprinting-canvas-measuretext-noise --fingerprinting-client-rects-noise --max-connections-per-host=15 --profile-directory=Default --enable-logging --v=1 --disable-extensions --flag-switches-end

title: Undefined symbols of ungoogled switches
body:
**Describe the bug**
Switches in the `switches` namespace are not exported.
```
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
  "switches::kFingerprintingClientRectsNoise", referenced from:
      (anonymous namespace)::SetRuntimeFeaturesFromCommandLine(base::CommandLine const&)::switchToFeatureMapping in runtime_features.o
      content::RenderProcessHostImpl::PropagateBrowserCommandLineToRenderer(base::CommandLine const&, base::CommandLine*)::kSwitchNames in render_process_host_impl.o
  "switches::kFingerprintingCanvasImageDataNoise", referenced from:
      (anonymous namespace)::SetRuntimeFeaturesFromCommandLine(base::CommandLine const&)::switchToFeatureMapping in runtime_features.o
      content::RenderProcessHostImpl::PropagateBrowserCommandLineToRenderer(base::CommandLine const&, base::CommandLine*)::kSwitchNames in render_process_host_impl.o
  "switches::kFingerprintingCanvasMeasureTextNoise", referenced from:
      (anonymous namespace)::SetRuntimeFeaturesFromCommandLine(base::CommandLine const&)::switchToFeatureMapping in runtime_features.o
      content::RenderProcessHostImpl::PropagateBrowserCommandLineToRenderer(base::CommandLine const&, base::CommandLine*)::kSwitchNames in render_process_host_impl.o
ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Build Chromium using own build process.

**Expected behavior**
Should not have such errors.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS/Platform and version: macOS 10.15.3
 - ungoogled-chromium version: 80.0.3987.132
* Using self-compiled LLVM toolchain, not Xcode one.

**Additional context**
It seems that normal build process has build config `//build/config/gcc:symbol_visibility_hidden` which adds `-fvisibility=hidden` flags, causing all symbols to be unexported unless explicitly requested. I had to remove that build config in `BUILD.gn` to make it compile:

```patch
component("switches") {
  sources = [
    "ungoogled_switches.h",
    "ungoogled_switches.cc",
  ]
+  configs -= [ "//build/config/gcc:symbol_visibility_hidden" ]
}
```

title: version 79+: patch causes crash on startup when both enable_widevine and is_official_build are set
body:
There is an issue with the following patch: https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/blob/master/patches/extra/debian_buster/fixes/widevine-enable-version-string.patch

When built with the gn flag `enable_widevine=true`, it causes `GetBundledWidevine()` to always be called if `ENABLE_WIDEVINE_CDM_COMPONENT` is defined. This function makes the following call:
```
CHECK(base::PathService::Get(chrome::DIR_BUNDLED_WIDEVINE_CDM,
                                     &install_dir));
```
It doesn't patch the `base::PathService::Get` function, so it always returns `false` unless `BUNDLE_WIDEVINE_CDM` is defined - which only happens on official Google builds.

The `CHECK()` macro will normally just print an error and then continue. However, if built with the gn flag `is_official_build=true`, it will insert an illegal instruction which will hard-crash the application. Note that `is_official_build` is NOT the "official Google Chrome build" flag that enables `BUNDLE_WIDEVINE_CDM`, that's a separate Google-only flag.

Although this patch won't cause any user-visible problems unless `is_official_build=true` is set, it also doesn't seem to actually do anything in chromium 79+, because `GetBundledWidevine()` will always fail.

The issue was fixed in the Gentoo ebuild by removing that specific patch: https://github.com/PF4Public/gentoo-overlay/issues/24

At least for Gentoo, the "bundled" Widevine isn't necessary; it includes a separate `chrome-binary-plugins` package which works with the new chromium-79 "component-updated" Widevine packaging. I'm not sure if something in this patch is necessary for other distributions/builds, but at the very least, it needs to patch the part of `base::PathService::Get` to get the `DIR_BUNDLED_WIDEVINE_CDM` directory correctly.

If the "bundled" Widevine code isn't necessary for all distros, would it be better to remove this patch and let each individual build apply the correct patch if necessary?

title: Remove lines causing Android build to fail
body: The removed lines in the patch will lead to wrong number of arguments when building for Android.

title: googleapis font patch contains a file which gets removed
body:
patches/core/ungoogled-chromium/disable-fonts-googleapis-references.patch includes a change to third_party/catapult/third_party/polymer/components/font-roboto/roboto.html

roboto.html gets removed (presumably after the above patch is applied) via third_party/catapult/third_party/polymer/components getting overwritten by a symlink to third_party/polymer/v1_0/components-chromium.

Directly extracting third_party/polymer/v1_0/components-chromium/font-roboto/roboto.html from the chromium xz tar archive reveals one line of code....

`<link rel="stylesheet" href="chrome://resources/css/roboto.css">`

Since this is identical to what the patch would have produced, the hunk relating to roboto.html can be removed from disable-fonts-googleapis-references.patch.

On debian there wouldn't normally have been any build errors unless one did a rebuild (in my case doing a pgo phase 2 rebuild), which throws an error about trying to patch a symlinked file.

title: Message: Can't update Chromium to latest version.
body:
I am using 77.0.3865.90 built from source on openSUSE Leap 15.1 (I haven't had the time to build a newer version). Today I noticed something weird which I haven't seen in any version so far. The browser shows a message:

"Can't update Chromium

Chromium couldn't update to the latest version, so you are missing out on new features and security fixes."

On one hand this seems logical: it is ungoogled, so it cannot connect to Google.

OTOH though: how could the browser possibly know that it is out of date without checking if new version exists at all (and if the current one is the latest)? Is it that Google assumed that there will be a new build forever, so it can show this message merely based on clock time/date?

IOW: is it that the browser has made a background connection to some remote host or just the nonsense assumption of Google?

title: DevTools profiling broken in 72.0.3626.122 macOS
body:
**Describe the bug**
Profiling in DevTools broken in 72.0.3626.122 on macOS. After pressing "stop" button it loading results infinity.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'https://popper.js.org/index.html'
2. Click on 'Cmd+I' (open DevTools)
3. Go to 'Performance' tab
4. Click 'Cmd+E' or Record button (start recording profile)
5. Do some activity on the page (scroll to bottom for ex)
6. Press stop button on performance collecting popup
7. Status will change to "Loading profile...", stop button will lock, but this state will never end...

**Expected behavior**
Step 7 from previous steps, should end with visible profile results.

**Screenshots**
![Step 7](http://vovkasm.skitch.vovkasm.org/chromium-bug_223BB7B1.png)

Sorry it was the last thing I did before going to bed. But the compile completed and I'm using it now. Thanks!

title: buildkit: Fix download progress showing over 100%
body:
When running build.py I noticed the download progress percentage going over 100% due to downloaded estimate being too high as blocks are 8KB each. If you have a 644B file the estimate will be 8kb, ~1200% too high.

Also the else statement here would never trigger as line 42, `percentage = round(downloaded_estimate / total_size, ndigits=3)`, would divide by zero giving an error, so I adjusted the order.

title: Crash on startup with user data directory having an associated Google account
body:
Originated from https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/issues/567#issuecomment-433194097. The browser unconditionally crashed on startup when the Google account was still tied to the user data directory.

Ideally, the browser shouldn't crash and just ignore the Google account. The user would then have the freedom to launch regular Chromium and still have the Google account. However, I don't mind if the solution must strip the Google account to preserve settings from the profile.

title: "enable_google_now" is an invalid argument on 70.x
body:
### Description

While trying to build the latest stable Chromium (70.0.3538.67), I got the following warning:

### Console output and logs

`gn args --list out/Release`
```
WARNING at build arg file (use "gn args <out_dir>" to edit):4:21: Build argument has no effect.
enable_google_now = false
                    ^----
The variable "enable_google_now" was set as a build argument
but never appeared in a declare_args() block in any buildfile.

To view all possible args, run "gn args --list <out_dir>"

The build continued as if that argument was unspecified.
```

### Environment details

* ungoogled-chromium version: **70.0.3538.67**
* Configuration bundle: **linux_rooted**
* Packaging type (if applicable): **none**
* OS and version for building: **Gentoo**
* Compiler toolchain: **LLVM/Clang/LLD 7.0.0**

### Building and packaging steps

Gentoo's Portage build system, from [here](https://gitlab.com/chaoslab/chaoslab-overlay/tree/master/www-client/ungoogled-chromium). Which is similar to the _PKGBUILD_ for Arch Linux.

title: flag-fingerprinting-canvas-webgl-noise.patch: Missing header file
body:
#### ungoogled-chromium version: 73d542afa83f213b70b1598a38bdda9b791bd3b0

#### Platform: Linux

### Problem description

Error during compilation:
```
In file included from gen/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/platform_jumbo_8.cc:56:
In file included from ../../third_party/ffmpeg/../../third_party/blink/renderer/platform/graphics/static_bitmap_image.cc:21:
../../third_party/skia/src/core/SkColorData.h:18:10: fatal error: 'SkTo.h' file not found
#include "SkTo.h"
         ^~~~~~~~
```

This can be worked around by modifying `third_party/blink/renderer/platform/BUILD.gn` and adding `//third_party/skia/include/private` to the [include_dirs](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/69.0.3497.72/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/BUILD.gn#1481) list of the `jumbo_component` configuration.

title: Problem inside vcxproj with xml validator, because of domain replacement
body:
I just start to generate some days ago visual studio solution to modify chromium.

Like this:
~~~
call out\Default\gn.exe gen out\Default --ide=vs --filters="//chrome/*;//base/*" --sln=chrome --fail-on-unused-args --no-deps
~~~

But a bug occur.
Inside each vcxproj, 

It replace each xml validator xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003" inside vcxproj by in invalid url validator "schemas.m1cr050ft.qjz9zk"

I think it is because of this script:
Could it be adapt ?
https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=m1cr050ft&type=

Inside 
> resources/config_bundles/common/domain_regex.list

This code change the way the vcxproj are generated
 `microsoft(\\*?)\.com#m1cr050ft\g<1>.qjz9zk`


The detour is to replace each `schemas.m1cr050ft.qjz9zk` by `schemas.microsoft.com` in each vcxproj.

@Eloston Does it exist an easy way to filter out "vcxproj" from domain replacing ?

title: Debian package missing dependency on gsettings-desktop-schemas

title: nasty little build error on macOS
body:
So here's a weird and nasty one.

Building on macOS, after the whole build was complete, the final packaging puked on me with the following rsync error:

`rsync: opendir "/var/empty/.anydesk/incoming" failed: Permission denied (13)`

...because apparently anydesk left an empty, root-owned directory under `/var/empty` on my mac.

I did a `sudo rm -rf /var/empty/*` and then tried various tricks to save the build but couldn't get anything to work so I had to get rid of the tree and do the whole build again. 

Frustrating.

It looks to me like the build is putting some stuff into `/var/empty` along the way and then copying it into the final package. I've no idea if that is peculiar to the mac build or common, but I wonder if it might be worthwhile to add a check at the beginning of the build for an empty `/var/empty` and abort and allow user to empty that directory if it's not.

```
chrome.privacy.services.safeBrowsingEnabled.get({}, function(x){})
```

Maybe related to the changes in `windows-fix-building-without-safebrowsing.patch`

title: New remove ev certificates patch breaks Windows build

The new remove ev certificates patch in 48d03e0 breaks in a Windows build. 

I think the previous approach was fine. It removed the data and left the implementation alone and let it operate on a zero-length array.

I see that you were concerned about the patch being fragile due to the use of the preprocessor. In this case I think it's actually fine, given that it's matching the start and end of the data array. title: linux_simple packaging fixes
body:
These are some fixes for linux_simple packaging problems that I ran into while trying to build on a Gentoo system

- Script resources (build.sh, packaging.sh, list_build_outputs.py) were not executable after being copied
- linux_simple.py failed because the ungoogled_packaging/scripts directory did not exist
- package.sh failed with `tar: Invalid transform expression`
- package.sh failed with `tar: You must specify one of the '-Acdtrux', '--delete' or '--test-label' options`

Perhaps some of this is related to version differences in the various utilities, I don't know. I'm on an updated Gentoo `~amd64` system

title: Cannot build v60 from the develop branch on Ubuntu 16.04
body:
I tried to build the new release on Ubuntu 16.04 and I found some problems.
Note: linux_conservative uses the main compiler on the system so I assume gcc is a valid option.

1. g++ doesn't work, unknown argument  `-fsanitize=cfi-vcall` (and maybe others)
2. Switched to clang++ (version 3.8) another unknown argument, `-fwhole-program-vtables`
3. Switched to clang++ (version 3.9) which should have this argument. ~~**Currently building.**~~ EDIT: failed (see comments below)

I know almost nothing about the building process of chromium so let me know how it should be handled.

To fix this now the following lines have to be changed:

- `use_clang=true` [here](https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/blob/develop/resources/configs/linux_conservative/gn_flags)
- `clang (>= 3.9) [here](https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/blob/develop/resources/packaging/debian/conservative/control) unless that missing argument had another name in 3.8 (I checked quickly on the [manual](http://releases.llvm.org/3.8.0/tools/clang/docs/UsersManual.html) but it doesn't look like it)
- remove gcc/g++ dependencies in the abovementioned file

If you run the master branch in Ubuntu 16.10, it will attempt to build the static version. It seems that `dist_codename` in `__init__.py` isn't returning the actual Ubuntu version, making it go for the static build.

```
        elif dist_id == "ubuntu" and (dist_codename == "yakkety"):
            from .debian import UbuntuXenialBuilder
```

Alternatively, it could be made so the user can run `build.py` with an argument to select the static build.

title: How can I install ungoogled-chromium on my Debian Jessie?
body:
How can I install `ungoogled-chromium` on my Debian Jessie? I think I have to build it manually, there's no simple way (yet)? I tried to build it with the instructions found in "Building" page, but I'm not really sure what I should do.

This is what I've tried:

We need `Python 3` and `Python 2` and `Ninja` to use `buildlib`, which is used to install `ungoogled-chromium`:

```
user@debian:~$ python3 --version
Python 3.4.2

user@debian:~$ python2 --version
Python 2.7.9

user@debian:~$ apt-get install ninja-build
```

Because we are using Debian Jessie, we need to do extra steps:

_"Note for Debian Jessie users: ungoogled-chromium is configured to build against the system's FFmpeg (available in Stretch and onwards); Libav (used in Jessie) will not work. However, FFmpeg is available in jessie-backports. To install it, add jessie-backports to the apt sources, and then install libavutil-dev, libavcodec-dev, and libavformat-dev from it. Note that this will replace Libav."_

Okay, let's add jessie-backports to our sources.list:
- Open and edit `/etc/apt/sources.list`
- Add this to the file `deb http://httpredir.debian.org/debian jessie-backports main`
- Save and exit
- Update and upgrade: `sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade`
- Now we need to install the `libavutil-dev`, `libavcodec-dev`, and `libavformat-dev` packages:

`sudo apt-get install libavutil-dev libavcodec-dev libavformat-dev`

Let's download the `ungoogled-chromium`:

```
wget https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/archive/master.zip
unzip master.zip
cd ungoogled-chromium-master
```

Okay, we have everything ready to go. Now we need to "invoke"(?) the `build.py` to install the `ungoogled-chromium`:

```
chmod +x build.py
./build.py
```

This is as far as I can go. `build.py` [throws me an error and the building will fail](http://pastebin.com/raw/p5mHDjR5).

**What am I doing wrong?**

title: Hardcoded GCC version in macOS
body:
The build fails due to hard coded GCC versions in the code. eg: 
`brew install gcc49` installs binary `x86_64-apple-darwin16.0.0-c++-4.9` on MacOS Sierra but the code has `x86_64-apple-darwin15.4.0-c++-4.9` and is hard coded in [resources/macos/patches/ungoogled-macos/fix-libcxx-archive-build-script.patch](https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/blob/master/resources/macos/patches/ungoogled-macos/fix-libcxx-archive-build-script.patch#L10) and [buildlib/macos.py](https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/blob/master/buildlib/macos.py#L72)

The versions can be put into a config file and can be parsed using ConfigParser but not sure how to include that version in the patch file(resources/macos/patches/ungoogled-macos/fix-libcxx-archive-build-script.patch)
